Reyne (1957: 115) described a new species of giant scales,
Walkeriana tosariensis ,
inhabiting
Casuarina junghuhniana Miq.
in East Java , and placed it in the genus
Walkeriana Signoret, 1876
with a doubt. The adult females of this species have an ovisac band of wax glands and form a large ovisac during oviposition in contrast to other species of
Walkeriana .
Taking this into account,
W. tosariensis
is transferred to the related genus
Hemaspidoproctus
, whose members, including the type species redescribed above, have the ovisac band and form more or less prominent ovisacs.
